alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Southern Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 22 at 3:21PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN EL DORADO COUNTY THROUGH 415 PM PDT... At 321 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Shingle Springs, or over Cameron Park, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Placerville, El Dorado Hills, Cameron Park, Coloma, Rescue, Pollock Pines, Camino, Smithflat, Latrobe, Garden Valley, Lotus, Chiquita Lake, Shingle Springs, Georgetown, Clarksville, and Diamond Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; Southern Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
